intro: Ruellia neglecta, commonly known as the common ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Ruellia neglecta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in landscaping.
